p: Between March 2 and 4, 2020, we admitted the second and third positive patients to the COVID area. As the number of patients infected with COVID-19 increased, we closed the transplant center and rearranged the ward’s central spaces to create hemodialysis rooms, intended partially for patients with SARS-CoV-2 infection and partially for patients who are negative for SARS-CoV-2 (see Table 1).
